solution_line_template: If Lizette's average on the {num_quizzes} quizzes is {average_3_quizzes}, then the sum of her scores in the {num_quizzes} quizzes is {average_3_quizzes} x {num_quizzes} = <<{average_3_quizzes}*{num_quizzes}={total_score_3_quizzes}>>{total_score_3_quizzes}.

This means that the sum of her scores in the first 2 quizzes is {total_score_3_quizzes} - {score_third_quiz} = <<{total_score_3_quizzes}-{score_third_quiz}={total_score_2_quizzes}>>{total_score_2_quizzes}.

Thus, her average for the first 2 quizzes is {total_score_2_quizzes}/{num_first_two_quizzes} = <<{total_score_2_quizzes}/{num_first_two_quizzes}={average_first_two_quizzes}>>{average_first_two_quizzes}.
